title: U.S. stock futures surge after Wall Street's best week since June
text:
On Friday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA gained 748.97 points, or 2.5%, to close at 31,082.56. The S&P 500 SPX climbed 86.97 points, or 2.4%, to finish at 3,752.75, and the Nasdaq Composite COMP rose 244.87 points, or 2.3%, to end at 10,859.72.

The three major indexes scored theirbiggest weekly percentage gains since Junelast week. For the week, the Dow rose 4.9%, the S&P 500 gained 4.7% and the Nasdaq advanced 5.2%.

Investors were heartened by reports that the Fed may back off slightly from its aggressive rate-hiking policy later this year.

The upcoming week is the busiest of the third-quarter earnings season, with 165 S&P 500 companies, including 12 Dow components reporting. That includes earnings from Big Tech companies Alphabet GOOGL, Amazon AMZN, Apple AAPL, Meta META and Microsoft MSFT.

U.S. stock futures surge after Wall Street's best week since June
